diagnoses.name: Marfan Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue, potentially leading to aneurysms and cardiovascular problems including chest pain.

diagnoses.name: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A group of disorders that affect connective tissues supporting the skin, bones, blood vessels, and many other organs and tissues, potentially causing aneurysms and chest pain.

diagnoses.name: Loeys-Dietz Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A disorder that affects the connective tissue in many parts of the body. Common features include aneurysms and vascular problems, which can lead to chest pain.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.description: A rare genetic condition causing sudden swelling of the skin and mucous membranes, which can include angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
diagnoses.description: A hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age. Symptoms may include decreased libido due to hormonal imbalance.

diagnoses.name: Hyperthyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland is overactive and produces excessive amounts of thyroid hormone, leading to a variety of symptoms including decreased libido.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition characterized by underproduction of thyroid hormones. Symptoms can include decreased libido and dysosmia due to metabolic disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Fibromuscular Dysplasia
diagnoses.description: A condition that causes abnormal growth or development of cells in the walls of blood vessels, which can lead to aneurysms.

diagnoses.name: Depression
diagnoses.description: A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities, causing significant impairment in daily life. Symptoms can include decreased libido.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.description: A group of mental health disorders characterized by significant anxiety or fear. Symptoms can include decreased libido.

diagnoses: Neurodegenerative disorders (e.g., Alzheimer's disease, for memory problems)
Infectious diseases (e.g., bacterial infection leading to leukocytosis)

diagnoses.name: Fibromyalgia
diagnoses.description: Fibromyalgia is a disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues. It may lead to difficulty concentrating (often referred to as 'fibro fog'), sensitivity to chemicals, and joint pains.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Chemical Sensitivity
diagnoses.description: Multiple Chemical Sensitivity (MCS) is a chronic condition characterized by adverse effects from exposure to low levels of commonly used chemicals. Symptoms include difficulty concentrating, joint pain, and a range of other systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
diagnoses.description: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS) is a complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that cannot be explained by any underlying medical condition. The fatigue worsens with physical or mental activity, but doesn't improve with rest. Symptoms include difficulty concentrating and joint pain.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.description: Rheumatoid Arthritis is a chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet. Symptoms include joint pain, stiffness, and fatigue, which might contribute to difficulty concentrating.

diagnoses.name: Parkinson's Disease
diagnoses.description: Parkinson's Disease is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement. Symptoms start gradually, sometimes starting with a barely noticeable tremor in just one hand. Blepharospasm may occur in the early stages, and difficulty concentrating can be a common non-motor symptom.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: Lyme disease is a bacterial infection you get from the bite of an infected tick. Early symptoms may include joint pain and cognitive impairments such as difficulty concentrating. If untreated, it can lead to neurological disorders.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: Sjögren's Syndrome is an autoimmune disease identified by its two most common symptoms — dry eyes and a dry mouth. It often accompanies other immune system disorders, such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus. Joint pain and difficulty concentrating are other symptoms experienced by patients.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: Hypothyroidism, or underactive thyroid, is a condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones. Symptoms include joint pain, sensitivity to cold, and cognitive difficulties like poor concentration.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.description: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental health disorders that include generalized anxiety disorder, panic disorder, and others. They can lead to difficulty concentrating, muscle tension, and sometimes physical symptoms related to stress such as joint pain.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune disease in which the body's immune system mistakenly attacks healthy tissue. It can affect the skin, joints, kidneys, brain, and other organs, causing a wide range of symptoms, including joint pain and cognitive issues like difficulty concentrating.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue, difficulty focusing, and potential connection to immune system problems.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.description: A metabolic disease that may lead to symptoms such as vision problems, and in long-term cases, may contribute to kidney issues affecting fertility.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: An underactive thyroid gland can contribute to presyncope, difficulty focusing, and in some cases, infertility.

diagnoses.name: Lupus (Systemic Lupus Erythematosus)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that can cause a wide range of symptoms, including difficulty focusing, lymphadenopathy, and potentially impacting reproductive health.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A disease of the central nervous system that can lead to vision problems, fatigue, and sometimes bladder issues such as interstitial cystitis.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects moisture-producing glands but can also lead to systemic symptoms like lymphadenopathy and fatigue.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: Beyond its well-known immune system impacts, HIV/AIDS can cause a variety of symptoms including lymphadenopathy, and indirectly affect fertility.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease that might manifest through lymphadenopathy, and could potentially affect vision, and other organs.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: A tick-borne illness that can cause a wide range of symptoms, potentially including vision difficulty, fatigue, and in rare cases, reproductive health issues.

diagnoses.name: Celiac Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine, potentially affecting fertility and possibly linked with fatigue and other symptoms indirectly.

diagnoses.name: Behcet's Disease
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disorder affecting multiple parts of the body, including the blood vessels. This condition can cause mouth ulcers, skin lesions, and eye inflammation, among other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Lichen Planus
diagnoses.description: A chronic inflammatory condition affecting the skin and mucous membranes, leading to white patches, ulcers, and in some cases, mood changes due to the chronic nature of the disease.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
diagnoses.description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make it difficult to breathe, leading to symptoms such as wheezing. The chronic stress from the illness can affect the patient's mood.

diagnoses.name: Asthma
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus. This can make breathing difficult and trigger coughing, wheezing, and shortness of breath.

diagnoses.name: Osteoporosis
diagnoses.description: A bone disease that occurs when the body loses too much bone, makes too little bone, or both, leading to weakened bones. While osteopenia is a precursor to osteoporosis, factors causing osteopenia may also cause osteoporosis.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease in which the body's immune system mistakenly attacks its own tissues, causing widespread inflammation and tissue damage in the affected organs, including the skin and lungs.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) damages the immune system and interferes with the body's ability to fight the organisms that cause disease. Notably, it can cause mouth ulcers and leukoplakia.

diagnoses.name: Sjogren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that provide lubrication to the mouth and eyes, primarily causing dry mouth and eyes, but can also lead to more severe systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease that affects multiple organs in the body, but mostly the lungs and lymph glands. In some cases, it can lead to skin lumps, eye inflammation, and wheezing.

diagnoses.name: Eosinophilic Esophagitis
diagnoses.description: An allergic inflammatory condition of the esophagus that can lead to ulcers and chronic pain or discomfort in the chest. Although it mainly affects the esophagus, it can be part of a systemic allergic response that affects mood and other bodily functions.

diagnoses: Squamous cell carcinoma of the mouth
Vitamin deficiency (e.g., vitamin B12, folate deficiency)

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests
dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses.reasoning: Presents with classic symptoms of depression, contributing significantly to the overall symptomatology.
Autoimmune disease characterized by dry eyes (keratoconjunctivitis sicca) and can lead to systemic complications, possibly explaining malabsorption.
Symptoms of endometriosis include chronic pelvic pain and can be associated with mood changes, contributing to depression.
Recurrent angioedema without urticaria is characteristic of this genetic disorder, potentially complicated by malabsorption due to intestinal angioedema.
An autoimmune disease that causes malabsorption in response to gluten, which could also lead to nutritional deficiencies affecting mood and causing depression.
Can cause depression, dry skin (including dry eyes), and can contribute to malabsorption. Hypothyroidism also increases the risk of autoimmune disorders.
Characterized by profound tiredness, it can also present with malabsorption and symptoms such as depression.
Though primarily characterized by widespread pain, it often coexists with depression and could indirectly contribute to or exacerbate other symptoms.
While primarily affecting the gastrointestinal tract and potentially explaining malabsorption, IBS is also associated with a higher incidence of depression and anxiety.

An autoimmune disease that can cause a wide range of symptoms, including joint pain, skin rashes, dry eyes, neurological symptoms (potentially leading to depression), and has been associated with endometriosis.

diagnoses: Secondary headache due to arterial hypertension
Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (GPA, formerly Wegener's Granulomatosis)
Evans Syndrome (Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia and Thrombocytopenia)
Evans Syndrome (Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with ITP)
Vasculitis (e.g., microscopic polyangiitis, eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis)
Malignancies, such as lymphoma or leukemia
